FSW.content: Freud: dream-interpreters were versed in symbolic riddling, a ground of interpretation giving the strongest credit to their Art
FSW.linkedContent: Freud: dream-interpreters were versed in symbolic riddling, a ground of interpretation giving the strongest credit to their Art

FSW.content: Egyptian priests read hieroglyphic code of dreams as a Traumbuch, as condensed meanings contained in storehouse of hieroglyphics [Freud pushes psychical writing further back]
FSW.linkedContent: Egyptian priests read hieroglyphic code of dreams as a Traumbuch, as condensed meanings contained in storehouse of hieroglyphics [Freud pushes psychical writing further back]

FSW.content: for Freud, dreamer invents his own grammar; Freud makes psychical writing so originary, any supposedly proper writing would have to be a metaphor for it
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, dreamer invents his own grammar; Freud makes psychical writing so originary, any supposedly proper writing would have to be a metaphor for it

FSW.content: Freud adds an idiomatic residue to symbolic, hieroglyphic dream-writing > thus limitation of Egyptian priest’s Chiffriermethode via Traumbuch [p. 210 but Freud proposes his own codes]
FSW.linkedContent: Freud adds an idiomatic residue to symbolic, hieroglyphic dream-writing > thus limitation of Egyptian priest’s Chiffriermethode via Traumbuch [p. 210 but Freud proposes his own codes]

FSW.content: it is the materiality of signifier that is relinquished in translation > when materiality is reinstated, translation becomes poetry
FSW.linkedContent: it is the materiality of signifier that is relinquished in translation > when materiality is reinstated, translation becomes poetry

FSW.content: since materiality of signifier constitutes idiom of dream scene, dreams are untranslatable
FSW.linkedContent: since materiality of signifier constitutes idiom of dream scene, dreams are untranslatable

FSW.content: dream-content (manifest) is a transposition which must be transposed back to dream-thoughts (latent)
FSW.linkedContent: dream-content (manifest) is a transposition which must be transposed back to dream-thoughts (latent)

FSW.content: speech, phonetic writing, exceeded by overall writing of dreams, Egyptian cartoon captions, rebuses, picture puzzle (Bilderrätzel)
FSW.linkedContent: speech, phonetic writing, exceeded by overall writing of dreams, Egyptian cartoon captions, rebuses, picture puzzle (Bilderrätzel)

FSW.content: in Freud & Artaud, subordination of speech on dream-stage
FSW.linkedContent: in Freud & Artaud, subordination of speech on dream-stage

FSW.content: Freud: proximity in dream reveals unthought connection like a & b in “ab”
FSW.linkedContent: Freud: proximity in dream reveals unthought connection like a & b in “ab”

TC.content: visual/plastic materialization of speech in Artaud’s theater and in Freud’s dreams, words as “things” [cf. F p. xl] (cartoon bubbles in Ancient Egypt [FSW p. 218]) > compare dreams to hieroglyphs, rebuses, a system of writing (instead of a language)
TC.linkedContent: visual/plastic materialization of speech in Artaud’s theater and in Freud’s dreams, words as “things” [cf. F p. xl] (cartoon bubbles in Ancient Egypt [FSW p. 218]) > compare dreams to hieroglyphs, rebuses, a system of writing (instead of a language)

ROP.content: Freud: navel of dream, where it touches the unknown
ROP.linkedContent: Freud: navel of dream, where it touches the unknown

ROP.content: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic
ROP.linkedContent: if the verborgene Sinn (hidden sense) is homogenous to order of analyzable > psychoanalytic reason as hermeneutic

ROP.content: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel
ROP.linkedContent: Freud sutures the unfathomable navel, omphalos, mit dem Unerkannten (unknown, “unknowable”), navel not a provisional limit, but a night, ab-solute unknown, attaché au lieu dont il part et dont il garde la marque de naissance > not only the gap (la béance), as Lacan reads this navel

ROP.content: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien
ROP.linkedContent: what forever exceeds the analysis of the dream: a knot that can’t be untied, un fil, qui, pour être coupé, comme un cordon ombilical, n’en reste pas moins à jamais noué [knotted even when cut], à même le corps, a la place du nombril [name?] > la cicatrice est un noeud contre lequel l’analyse ne peut rien

ROP.content: Silberer’s “anagogic” interpretation concerns the most profound, depth of meaning, Stoff of dreams; Freud counters: some dreams can’t be interpreted, some dreams do not require over-interpretation (Uberdeutung)
ROP.linkedContent: Silberer’s “anagogic” interpretation concerns the most profound, depth of meaning, Stoff of dreams; Freud counters: some dreams can’t be interpreted, some dreams do not require over-interpretation (Uberdeutung)

FS.content: Delacroix: two lines give meaning; Freud: valley a common female dream symbol [column, hollowed margin]
FS.linkedContent: Delacroix: two lines give meaning; Freud: valley a common female dream symbol [column, hollowed margin]

REST.content: “according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality
REST.linkedContent: “according to the circumstances,” [Freud’s bisexuality of most dream-symbols] also occurs acc. syntax irreducible to semantic or “symbolic” substantiality

OG.content: Freud: mutism in a dream represents death
OG.linkedContent: Freud: mutism in a dream represents death

FV.content: Stoff (incest w/ mother, murder of father), all else (i.e. tragic destiny) is secondary > the analytic deciphering: denuding (mise à nu) of this Stoff beneath secondary disguises: naked truth, truth as nakedness, meaning behind the formal disguises
FV.linkedContent: Stoff (incest w/ mother, murder of father), all else (i.e. tragic destiny) is secondary > the analytic deciphering: denuding (mise à nu) of this Stoff beneath secondary disguises: naked truth, truth as nakedness, meaning behind the formal disguises

FV.content: exhibiting, undressing (déshabillage), unveiling (dévoilement): acrobatics of metaphor of truth, metaphor of metaphor, truth of truth > when Freud intends to denude original Stoff: text coordinated à sa vérité nue, mais aussi à la vérité comme nudité
FV.linkedContent: exhibiting, undressing (déshabillage), unveiling (dévoilement): acrobatics of metaphor of truth, metaphor of metaphor, truth of truth > when Freud intends to denude original Stoff: text coordinated à sa vérité nue, mais aussi à la vérité comme nudité

FV.content: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse
FV.linkedContent: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse

FV.content: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dream recasts [Stoff] in Einkleidung (garment, disguising, falsifying), the emperor is the dreamer, the imposter is the dream

FV.content: Freud pays no attention to a fold in the text [Emperor’s…], literary narrative is a secondary elaboration, thus an Einkleidung > since Andersens’ text has the text as its theme, it puts Freud’s text [interpretation] onstage
FV.linkedContent: Freud pays no attention to a fold in the text [Emperor’s…], literary narrative is a secondary elaboration, thus an Einkleidung > since Andersens’ text has the text as its theme, it puts Freud’s text [interpretation] onstage

FV.content: if dream of nakedness is a dream of shame, nakedness is not natural: its truth is in shame
FV.linkedContent: if dream of nakedness is a dream of shame, nakedness is not natural: its truth is in shame

FV.content: hidden theme of Emperor’s… is the hidden theme, text as its theme, text as veil, movement of alētheia
FV.linkedContent: hidden theme of Emperor’s… is the hidden theme, text as its theme, text as veil, movement of alētheia
